{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3553959,"name":"","username":"LPryor","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lpryor/{size}/220287_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-11T13:59:50.703Z","cooked":"

Hi - I’m looking for the correct pattern for to fine tune the alignment of our robot for scoring.
We’re using sensors to detect the reef pole and do a final alignment before scoring. Think 0.1m- 0.2m. We initially used pathplanner but found that it stops working when the distances get below 0.3m. (it looks like it thinks it’s already in the target location)

What we want to do is have a command that sends a strafe command to the drive and moves the robot left or right until our sensors tell us we have good alignment. But we’re having trouble making that work.

We’ve tried drivetrain.applyRequest() and drivetrain.setCommand() and neither worked for us. ApplyRequest will start the drive but we can’t stop it. And SetCommand doesn’t make the robot move at all.

Our code is based on the CTRE/Pathplanner example.
What is the right pattern for this? An example would be welcome.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-03-11T13:59:50.703Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":19,"reads":121,"readers_count":120,"score":119.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":495148,"topic_slug":"fine-tune-ctre-swerve-alignment","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55309,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor 8280, President Motor City Alliance"},"post_url":"/t/fine-tune-ctre-swerve-alignment/495148/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3553961,"name":"","username":"LPryor","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lpryor/{size}/220287_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-11T14:03:21.799Z","cooked":"

We’ve been able to make it move using user driven commands in the Robot Container. Example this POV

driverController.pov(0).whileTrue(drivetrain.applyRequest(() → forwardStraight.withVelocityX(0.5).withVelocityY(0)));

I was thinking we could hack a trigger into the RobotContainer to do the same thing. But that’s feels REALLY hacky. Looking for the “right” way to do this.

Keep in mind that drivetrain.applyRequest() returns a Command and you can use normal Command decorators on it.

You can use the .until() decerator to add an end condition to the command.

FIRST Robotics Competition Documentation

Command Compositions

Individual commands are capable of accomplishing a large variety of robot tasks, but the simple three-state format can quickly become cumbersome when more advanced functionality requiring extended ...

That’s helpful. I pinged CTRE and they said the same as well as info on building my own swerve request that can have more complex and nuanced logic. Giving me the pattern I need.
